STUDIOS—UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON
CHANNEL
KCTS-TV
TRANSMITTER—EDISON TECHNICAL SCHOOL
SEATTLE 5, WASHINGTON
January 31* 1961
Bill Harley
NAEB
Washington, D. C.
Dear Bill:
I have studied the two drafts of Jim Robertson's of
January 21, and they seem to be so much better thqn
the previous draft, I can see nothing wrong there now*
I am quite delighted with the apparent willingness to
work together, rather than "divide" up the areas of
responsibility and "grab" what needs to be held for
purposed of establishing "prestige" or "security".
I had a very nice letter from Jim, telling me of the
progress that is being made. He was most conplimentary
about the way you were working on this, and pleased that
he and you were in such general agreement. He said that
Jack was coming along fine •— he says "Jack's attitude
is improving daily".
It is a real satisfaction to see things developing in
this way. Bill and I hope the February 2 meeting goes
along in the same vein*
I'm enclosing a copy of my reply to Aim's recent
letter.
Loren B. Stone
University of Washington Seattle Public Schools • King County Schools Seattle University Seattle Pacific College Seattle Public Library
